thread.title: Japan's Meiji Yasuda to acquire StanCorp Financial for USD5b
thread.title_full: Japan's Meiji Yasuda to acquire StanCorp Financial for USD5b | MENAFN.COM

title: Japan's Meiji Yasuda to acquire StanCorp Financial for USD5b
text:
(MENAFN) Japanese Meiji Yasuda Life Insurer said it is set to buy StanCorp Financial Group for USD5 billion, aiming to expand its overseas business amid limited domestic growth, Oman Observer reported.

Meiji Yasuda said in its statement that the purchase of the US group, one of the biggest transactions ever by a Japanese life insurance company, is part of its bid to expand profits.

In the past five years, Japanese insurance firms have announced acquisitions worth around USD28 billion as they eye business outside their home market, where they are faced with shrinking growth.

"We will position StanCorp as an important base in the US market that is the largest in the world and is expected to see mid- and long-term stable growth," the company said.
